page.title: 20Edouard de Carteret
page.content:
The{de Carterets}are a very important{royalist}Jersey family. They have played a large part in the history of Jersey, the English Monarchy and the founding of New Jersey in America. Sir Edouard de Carteret (d.l698) was the first{Black Rod}to knock on and open the doors of the U.K. Parliament when it reassembled after the{Civil {War.} He later returned to Jersey and became{Bailiff.} Legend has it that, when he died his body was being taken to St.{Ouen's {Church}by horse and cart. A storm made the horses bolt and, unable to continue the journey, he was buried in the Lady Chapel of{Trinity Church.}
CREDITS: Trinity and St. Martin's Primary School and d'Hautree Secondary
